description: From earlier passtime, pass-time, from Middle English passe tyme, passetyme, calque of Middle French passetemps.

entries.meaning: Something which amuses, and serves to make time pass agreeably.

verbs.description: pastime (third-person singular simple present pastimes, present participle pastiming, simple past and past participle pastimed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, obsolete) to sport; to amuse oneself
